data.txt: The more opinionated, the more attention. What happened to KISS?

Having a clear plan is key to success. Changing your website is just a small part in what should be a bigger plan to improve.

Do not assume 3rd party libraries are going to be micro frontends ready.
Using a password manager should be much more important than a mandatory password rotation cycle.
Amazed with the joy I have working in Flutter. IDE integration, performance, learning curve... It is all excellent.

Just running won't do. Cross training is really recommended.
Starting a project? Document it... Everything.
What goes up, must come down. In running... what goes down, must come up.
Writing tests is important, but the tests need to have a purpose and the assertions should make sense.

I recommend Redux for state management. Why? You can use it with (almost) anything.

Compile a build to see app performance
